article.name: Integrate Adlumin with Your KnowBe4 Console
article.title: Integrate Adlumin with Your KnowBe4 Console
article.body:
KnowBe4’s integration with Adlumin combines KSAT phishing and training data with Adlumin's Proactive Defense Program. The Proactive Defense Program monitors your users’ phishing and training results to identify high-risk users and maintain compliance.

Before You Connect Adlumin to Your KSAT Console

Before integrating Adlumin into your KSAT console, you must find your API address and create a Reporting Event API key. Follow the steps below to do both actions.

  1. Your API address depends on where your KnowBe4 account is located. Please see the table below to find the API address for your region. 

    Region

    		 Base URL
    US

    https://us.api.knowbe4.com
    CA

    https://ca.api.knowbe4.com
    EU

    https://eu.api.knowbe4.com
    UK

    https://uk.api.knowbe4.com
    DE

    https://de.api.knowbe4.com
  2. Log in to your KSAT console as an admin.
  3. Navigate to Account Settings in the top-right corner under your account’s email address.
  4. In Account Settings, navigate to Account Integrations.
  5. Under Account Integrations, navigate to API > Reporting API.
  6. On the Reporting API tab, click the + Create New API Token button to open the API token creation screen.
  7. Enter a name for the token, then click Create Token.
  8. Please save this API token for the below steps.

Connecting Adlumin to Your KSAT Console

To set up this integration, you will need to connect your KSAT console to your Adlumin Command Console by following the steps below:

  1. Log in to your Adlumin Command Console admin account.
  2. From the Services tab at the top of the page, click Proactive Defense Program.
  3. Return to your Adlumin Command Console and click Support at the top of the page.
  4. Send a request to Adlumin Support to finish setting up your KnowBe4 integration. Make sure to have your Reporting API Token and API address from the above steps, which Adlumin Support will need to establish the connection.

Once the connection is established, your Proactive Defense Program dashboards and reports will begin to populate with phishing campaign and Risk Score data from your users’ KSAT accounts.

For more information about the Adlumin integration, please contact Adlumin Support.

images.alt:
The image displays a system configuration interface focused on API integration settings.

**Context and Navigation:**
The left navigation panel shows the main categories of the settings menu. The **`Account Integrations`** parent category is expanded, and the sub-item **`API`** is currently selected and highlighted.

**Main Content Area:**
The primary content section is titled **`API`**. It features configuration options for two distinct API endpoints: Reporting API and User Event API.

**Reporting API Configuration:**
1.  **Access Toggle:** A toggle switch labeled **`Enable Reporting API Access`** is set to the 'On' (Enabled) position (indicated by blue coloring).
2.  **Documentation Links:** Two informational links are present:
    *   A globe icon preceding the hyperlink **`Reporting API`** (followed by an information icon).
    *   A documentation icon preceding the hyperlink **`Reference Documentation`**.

**User Event API Configuration:**
This subsection mirrors the structure of the Reporting API documentation, offering two links:
1.  A globe icon preceding the hyperlink **`User Event API`** (followed by an information icon).
2.  A documentation icon preceding the hyperlink **`Reference Documentation`**.
images.context:

images.alt:
The image displays the **KnowBe4 APIs** management page, focused on the **Reporting API** tab (active).

**Key Interface Elements:**
1.  **Navigation:** Tabs are present for **Reporting API**, **User Event API**, and **Product API**. A link to return to **Account Settings** is in the top right corner.
2.  **Action Area:** Above the token list, there is a link for **Reference Documentation** and a primary blue button labeled **+ Create New API Token**. (A red arrow highlights this button).

**API Token Table:**
The screen features a data grid listing existing API tokens. The table headers include:
*   Key (with an information icon)
*   Name
*   Generated By
*   Generated On
*   Status
*   Actions

**Current Data Displayed:**
One row is displayed (**"Displaying all 1 rows"**):
*   **Name:** IntegrationsToken
*   **Generated On:** 11/11/2024
*   **Status:** A green checkmark icon (indicating Active status).
The fields for Key and Generated By are intentionally redacted/blurred.

images.alt:
This image depicts an active dropdown menu or flyout panel, anchored below a primary navigation bar.

**Contextual Elements (Navigation Bar):**
1.  The active menu anchor is labeled "**Services**" and includes a downward-pointing chevron, indicating a dropdown control.
2.  An adjacent, inactive primary link, labeled "**Support**," is partially visible to the right.

**Dropdown Menu Content:**
The menu contains two distinct clickable service links, both displayed in standard text and highlighted with a notification badge.

1.  **Menu Item 1:** "**Continuous Vulnerability Management**"
    *   **Annotation:** This item is immediately followed by a small, rectangular badge rendered in yellow/amber, containing the uppercase text "**NEW**."
2.  **Menu Item 2:** "**Proactive Defense Program**"
    *   **Annotation:** This item is also immediately followed by an identical yellow/amber badge containing the uppercase text "**NEW**."
images.context: Services tab at the top of the page, click Proactive Defense Program.

images.alt:
This image displays a security awareness dashboard titled **“Proactive Defense Program,”** segmented into four navigation tabs: **Dashboard** (selected), **Phishing**, **Training**, and **Reports**.

**Header and Context:**
The interface includes a standard top navigation bar featuring global links such as **Settings, Learning Center, Reporting, Tools, Modules, Tenants, Services,** and **Support**. The logged-in user is **Adlumin Admin**, operating within the tenant context of **“TENANT: Demonstration Tenant.”**

**Dashboard Summary (KPIs):**
Four horizontal metric cards provide high-level summaries: **Organization Score**, **Total Campaigns**, **Phishing Clicks** (highlighted in red), and **Incomplete Training** (highlighted in yellow).

**Phishing Security Tests:**
This section presents detailed results over time.
1.  **Key Legend:** Identifies four data series: **Clicks** (Red dot), **Data Entered** (Dark red dot), **Industry Average** (Blue line/square), and **Phish-prone %** (Black line/square).
2.  **Chart:** A combined bar and line chart covering **“Last 6 Months.”** The chart tracks phish-prone percentage (Y-axis) against campaign results.
3.  **Quantitative Summary:** Detailed metric totals are listed below the chart: **33 Clicks • 2 Replies • 0 Attachments Opened • 0 Macro Enabled • 0 Data Entered • 0 QR Codes Scanned • 0 Reported.**

**Industry Benchmark Data Panel:**
Located adjacent to the chart, this panel provides comparative data and filtering options:
*   **Account average phish-prone %:** 31.3%
*   **Last Campaign phish-prone %:** 31.6%
*   **Industry phish-prone %:** 18.8%
Configurable dropdown filters are available for **Industry** ("All Industries" selected), **Organization Site** ("Small (<250 users)" selected), and **Program Maturity** ("Baseline" selected). A toggle switch controls visibility of **Industry Bench Mark Chart Data**.

**Active Campaigns:**
The final section is a placeholder for a data table titled **“Active Campaigns,”** with columns established for **Title, Type, Group,** and **Complete.**
images.context: begin to populate with phishing campaign and Risk Score data from your users’ KSAT accounts.
